channel.title: high-level synthesis on Rachit Nigam

item.title: Compiling for the Reconfigurable Future
item.description: Moore’s law is in its death throes. With Global Foundries announcing that they are no longer pursuing 7nm production nodes, fabrication companies focusing on incremental improvements instead of doubling computing power, and the end of the arguably more important Denard’s scaling the death of computer architectures as we know them is coming close. While not obvious in text, I say “death of computer architectures” in the most optimistic way possible.
